page.title: 02EBENEZER CHAPEL,DUNVANT
page.content: In 1872 a small chapel was erected to serve the village,bilingual services being taken by the minister of Three Crosses Chapel.By 1876 membership had increased and a minister was appointed to take sole charge.Growth in local mining brought an increase in popul- ation.The original chapel was enlarged by adding a corrugated iron structure but even this later proved inadequate to cater for the increased membership and in 1893 the present chapel was built to accommodate 500 people.The chapel was the cultural and social centre of the village.Closure of local industries led to a decline in popul- ation and consequently of the chapel membership but it remains an important element of village life.The Vestry is used for meetings of senior citizens,a horticultural society and a Welsh- speaking playgroup.
